HB 1611.name: HB 1611 Virginia College Savings Plan; prepaid tuition contracts, pricing reserves.

HB 1612.name: HB 1612 Game and Inland Fisheries, Department of; fees, boat ramps.

history.text: 08/15/18  House: Prefiled and ordered printed; offered 01/09/19 19100271D
08/15/18  House: Referred to Committee on Agriculture, Chesapeake and Natural Resources

HB 1612.committeeText: 08/15/18  House: Referred to Committee on Agriculture, Chesapeake and Natural Resources
HB 1612.summary:
Department of Game and Inland Fisheries; fees;
boat ramps. Removes  the use of boat ramps owned by the Department
of Game and Inland Fisheries from  the list of exceptions to the requirement
that users of certain facilities pay a  fee. The bill contains technical
amendments.

HB 1613.name: HB 1613 Wanton waste; penalty.

history.text: 08/21/18  House: Prefiled and ordered printed; offered 01/09/19 19100057D
08/21/18  House: Referred to Committee on Agriculture, Chesapeake and Natural Resources

HB 1613.committeeText: 08/21/18  House: Referred to Committee on Agriculture, Chesapeake and Natural Resources
HB 1613.summary:
Penalty for wanton waste. Changes from a
Class 3  misdemeanor to a Class 2 misdemeanor the penalty for violating
a regulation  prohibiting wanton waste, or the allowing of a killed
or  crippled game animal or nonmigratory game bird to be wasted without
 making a reasonable effort to retrieve the animal.

HB 1614.name: HB 1614 Local Stormwater Management Fund; grant moneys.

history.text: 08/28/18  House: Prefiled and ordered printed; offered 01/09/19 19100149D
08/28/18  House: Referred to Committee on Counties, Cities and Towns

HB 1614.committeeText: 08/28/18  House: Referred to Committee on Counties, Cities and Towns
HB 1614.summary:
Local Stormwater Management Fund; grant moneys.
 Authorizes any locality to provide by ordinance for  the creation
of a local Stormwater Management Fund (the Fund) for the purpose 
of granting funds to an owner of private property or a common interest
 community for stormwater management and erosion prevention. The bill
requires  grants from the Fund to be used exclusively for construction,
improvement, or  repair of a stormwater management facility or for
 erosion and sediment control. The Fund shall exclusively  comprise
appropriated local moneys.

HB 1615.name: HB 1615 Elections; date of June primary election.

history.text: 08/28/18  House: Prefiled and ordered printed; offered 01/09/19 19100239D
08/28/18  House: Referred to Committee on Privileges and Elections

HB 1615.committeeText: 08/28/18  House: Referred to Committee on Privileges and Elections
HB 1615.summary:
Elections; date of June primary election.
Changes the  date of the primary election held in June from the second
Tuesday in June to  the third Tuesday in June. The bill also changes
candidate filing deadlines to  reflect the change of date.

HB 1616.name: HB 1616 Firearms; use or display during commission of a felony, killing or injuring police animals, penalty.

HB 1617.name: HB 1617 Campaign finance; prohibited personal use of campaign funds, civil penalty.

HB 1619.name: HB 1619 Children's Services Act; special education programs.

HB 1620.name: HB 1620 Elections, State Board of; membership, appointment of Commissioner of Elections.

HB 1621.name: HB 1621 Hunting license; trip hunting license for residents.

HB 1622.name: HB 1622 Child abuse or neglect; out-of-court and recorded statements made by a child.

HB 1623.name: HB 1623 Military families; relocation to the Commonwealth, student registration.

HB 1625.name: HB 1625 Animal care; adequate shelter, exposure to heat or cold.

HB 1626.name: HB 1626 Animal fighting; presumption where fowl tethered.

HB 1627.name: HB 1627 Child welfare agencies; Commissioner of Social Services shall prioritize inspection of agencies.

HB 1628.name: HB 1628 Absentee voting; persons age 65 or older.

HB 1629.name: HB 1629 Virginia Public Procurement Act; request for proposals, publication.

HB 1630.name: HB 1630 Judges, substitute; powers and duties, entry of a final order, cases taken under advisement.

HB 1631.name: HB 1631 Virginia Retirement System; retired law-enforcement officers employed as school security officers.

HB 1632.name: HB 1632 Virginia Public Procurement Act; multiple award indefinite delivery/indefinite quantity contracting.

HB 1633.name: HB 1633 Lt. Bradford T. Clark Memorial Bridge; designating as the State Route 627 bridge in Hanover County.

HB 1634.name: HB 1634 Sales & use tax for counties and cities; county appropriations to incorporated towns for education.

HB 1635.name: HB 1635 Fossil fuel projects moratorium; clean energy mandates.

HB 1636.name: HB 1636 Unmanned aircraft system; trespass, military airfield or military helicopter landing zone, penalty.

HB 1637.name: HB 1637 License plates, special; PROTECT SEA LIFE.

HB 1638.name: HB 1638 Virginia Lottery; regulation of sports betting, creation of certain Funds, etc.

HB 1639.name: HB 1639 Medical Assistance Services, Department of; payment for certain services to hospice patients.

HB 1640.name: HB 1640 Health carriers; services provided by nurse practitioners.

HB 1642.name: HB 1642 Solitary confinement; data collection and reporting, Department of Corrections to submit report.

HB 1643.name: HB 1643 Teacher licensure; endorsement, Montessori method.

HB 1644.name: HB 1644 Firearms; reporting when lost or stolen, civil penalty.

HB 1645.name: HB 1645 Virginia Fair Housing Law; unlawful discriminatory housing practices.

HB 1646.name: HB 1646 Virginia Preschool Initiative; enrollment, funding.

HB 1647.name: HB 1647 Virginia Fair Housing Law; unlawful discriminatory housing practices.

HB 1648.name: HB 1648 Pedestrian crossings; Town of Ashland may provide signs at crosswalks requiring drivers to yield.

HB 1649.name: HB 1649 Boundary agreement, local; locality allowed to attach to their petitions to circuit court a GIS map.

HB 1650.name: HB 1650 Lottery; disclosure of identity of winners.

HB 1651.name: HB 1651 Grand larceny; increases threshold amount.

HB 1652.name: HB 1652 School calendar; opening day of the school year.

HB 1653.name: HB 1653 Custody and visitation arrangements; best interests of the child, domestic abuse, child abuse.

HB 1654.name: HB 1654 Prohibited public carrying of certain firearms in public areas; penalty.

HB 1655.name: HB 1655 Real property tax exemption for disabled veterans; surviving spouses ability to change residence.

HB 1656.name: HB 1656 School security officers; employment by private or religious schools, carrying a firearm.

HB 1657.name: HB 1657 Alcoholic beverage control; creates an annual mixed beverage performing arts facility license.

HB 1658.name: HB 1658 Vote by mail; Department of Elections to develop a pilot program.

HB 1659.name: HB 1659 Child abuse and neglect; mandatory reporters.

HB 1660.name: HB 1660 Landlord and tenant; landlord may obtain certain insurance for tenant, notice to tenant.

HB 1661.name: HB 1661 Health benefits; plans established by associations of employers, certain agricultural organizations.

HB 1662.name: HB 1662 Child restraint devices and safety belts; exempts emergency and law-enforcement vehicles.

HB 1663.name: HB 1663 Food establishments; certified food protection manager, exemption of certain establishments.

HB 1664.name: HB 1664 Out-of-state conviction of drug offenses; petition for restricted driver's license.

HB 1665.name: HB 1665 Court-established community service programs; community service work in lieu of payment of fine,etc.

history.text: 12/03/18  House: Prefiled and ordered printed; offered 01/09/19 19102120D
12/03/18  House: Referred to Committee for Courts of Justice

HB 1665.committeeText: 12/03/18  House: Referred to Committee for Courts of Justice
HB 1665.summary:
Court-established community service  programs;
community service work in lieu of payment of fine  or costs. Requires
courts to provide an option to any person upon  whom a fine and costs
have been imposed to discharge all or part of the fine or  costs by
earning credits for the performance of community service work before
 or after imprisonment. Under current law, providing this option is
 discretionary.

HB 1666.name: HB 1666 University of Virginia's College at Wise; reduced rate tuition.

history.text: 12/03/18  House: Prefiled and ordered printed with emergency clause; offered 01/09/19 19101361D
12/03/18  House: Referred to Committee on Appropriations

HB 1666.committeeText: 12/03/18  House: Referred to Committee on Appropriations
HB 1666.summary:
University of Virginia's College at Wise; reduced
rate  tuition. Permits the board of visitors of the University
of Virginia to  charge reduced rate tuition to any student enrolled
at the University of Virginia's  College at Wise who resides in the
Appalachian Region as defined in relevant  federal law, is domiciled
in the Appalachian Region, and is entitled to  in-state tuition charges
at a public institution of higher education in the  Appalachian Region.
The bill contains an emergency clause.

HB 1667.name: HB 1667 Virginia Public Procurement Act; statute of limitations on actions on construction contracts, etc.

history.text: 12/03/18  House: Prefiled and ordered printed; offered 01/09/19 19101460D
12/03/18  House: Referred to Committee for Courts of Justice

HB 1667.committeeText: 12/03/18  House: Referred to Committee for Courts of Justice
HB 1667.summary:
Virginia Public Procurement Act; statute of
limitations on  actions on construction contracts; statute of limitations
on actions on  performance bonds. Provides that no action may
be brought by a public body on  any construction contract, including
construction management and design-build  contracts, unless such action
is brought within five years after substantial  completion of the
work on the project and that no action may be brought by a  public
body on a warranty or guarantee in such construction contract more
than  one year from the breach of that warranty, but in no event more
than one year  after the expiration of such warranty or guarantee.
The bill also limits the  time frame during which a public body, other
than the Department of  Transportation, may bring an action against
a surety on a performance bond to  within one year after substantial
completion of the work on the project.  Current law allows a public
body, other than the Department of Transportation, to  bring such
an action within one year after (i) completion of the contract,  including
the expiration of all warranties and guarantees, or (ii) discovery
of  the defect or breach of warranty that gave rise to the action.

HB 1668.name: HB 1668 Virginia Public Procurement Act; high-risk contracts, report.

history.text: 12/03/18  House: Prefiled and ordered printed; offered 01/09/19 19100629D
12/03/18  House: Referred to Committee on General Laws

HB 1668.committeeText: 12/03/18  House: Referred to Committee on General Laws
HB 1668.summary:
Virginia Public Procurement Act; high-risk contracts;
 report. Requires the Department of General Services (DGS), the
Virginia  Information Technologies Agency (VITA), and the Office of
the Attorney General,  as appropriate, to review contract solicitations
and contracts for any public  contract for goods, services, insurance,
or construction that meets the  definition of high-risk contract provided
in the bill. Employees designated as  primary administrators of high-risk
contracts are required to complete a  training program on effective
contract administration created by DGS and VITA  pursuant to requirements
of the bill prior to commencing high-risk contract  administration
duties. Some provisions of the bill have delayed effective dates 
for implementation of the high-risk contract training and review processes.

HB 1669.name: HB 1669 Disposable paper and plastic bags; local taxation per bag when provided to consumers.

history.text: 12/03/18  House: Prefiled and ordered printed; offered 01/09/19 19100447D
12/03/18  House: Referred to Committee on Finance

HB 1669.committeeText: 12/03/18  House: Referred to Committee on Finance
HB 1669.summary:
Local disposable paper and plastic bag tax.
Authorizes  any locality to impose a tax of five cents per bag  on
disposable paper bags or disposable plastic bags provided to consumers
by certain retailers, with certain bags being  exempt from the tax.
Revenues from the local tax would be collected by the Tax  Commissioner
and distributed monthly to the locality  imposing the tax to be used
by such locality for the mitigation of pollution  and litter. The
bill requires each locality imposing  the tax by ordinance to provide
a certified copy of the ordinance to the Tax  Commissioner at least
six months prior to the date the tax is to become  effective. The
bill also allows every retailer that collects the tax to retain  one
cent of the five-cent tax.

HB 1670.name: HB 1670 Affordable housing; City of Richmond added to list with authority to provide dwelling unit program.

history.text: 12/03/18  House: Prefiled and ordered printed; offered 01/09/19 19101221D
12/03/18  House: Referred to Committee on Counties, Cities and Towns

HB 1670.committeeText: 12/03/18  House: Referred to Committee on Counties, Cities and Towns
HB 1670.summary:
Affordable housing; City of Richmond. Adds
the City of  Richmond to the list of localities with authority to
provide for an affordable  housing dwelling unit program.

HB 1671.name: HB 1671 Child abuse and neglect; investigation of an individual by local boards of social services.

history.text: 12/03/18  House: Prefiled and ordered printed; offered 01/09/19 19100319D
12/03/18  House: Referred to Committee on Health, Welfare and Institutions

HB 1671.committeeText: 12/03/18  House: Referred to Committee on Health, Welfare and Institutions
HB 1671.summary:
Child abuse and neglect; investigations by local
boards of  social services. Requires local boards of social services,
when  investigating an individual who is the subject of child abuse
or neglect allegations, to obtain and consider a search  of the child
abuse and neglect central registry, or  equivalent registry, of any
state in which the individual has resided  within the preceding five
years.

HB 1672.name: HB 1672 Income tax, state; tax credit for paid leave for organ donors.

history.text: 12/03/18  House: Prefiled and ordered printed; offered 01/09/19 19100206D
12/03/18  House: Referred to Committee on Finance

HB 1672.committeeText: 12/03/18  House: Referred to Committee on Finance
HB 1672.summary:
Income tax credit for paid leave for organ donors.
 Establishes a tax credit, for taxable years 2019 through 2023, of
35 percent of  an employer's expenses in providing paid leave to an
employee for the purpose  of making an organ donation. The credit
is available for expenses related to a  leave period of up to 10 days
and includes only those expenses incurred paying  an employee during
his leave period or for the cost of temporary replacement  help. Expenses
are not eligible for the credit if the employee earns $80,000 or 
more per year. The credit is nonrefundable but may be carried forward
for up to five years.

HB 1673.name: HB 1673 Protective orders, preliminary; full hearing date if an act of God causes closure of a court, etc.

HB 1674.name: HB 1674 Abuse and neglect of incapacitated adults; informed consent.

history.text: 12/03/18  House: Prefiled and ordered printed; offered 01/09/19 19100716D
12/03/18  House: Referred to Committee for Courts of Justice

HB 1674.committeeText: 12/03/18  House: Referred to Committee for Courts of Justice
HB 1674.summary:
Abuse and neglect of incapacitated adults; informed
 consent. Clarifies, for the purposes of the informed consent
exemption to abuse and neglect of incapacitated adults, that the 
informed consent of the incapacitated person must have been  given
when such person was not incapacitated. The bill  provides that its
provisions are declaratory of existing law.

HB 1675.name: HB 1675 Servicemembers Civil Relief Act; attorney fees.

history.text: 12/04/18  House: Prefiled and ordered printed; offered 01/09/19 19101973D
12/04/18  House: Referred to Committee for Courts of Justice

HB 1675.committeeText: 12/04/18  House: Referred to Committee for Courts of Justice
HB 1675.summary:
Servicemembers Civil Relief Act; attorney fees.
Provides  that, where the appointment of counsel is necessary
pursuant to the  Servicemembers Civil Relief Act, any attorney fees
assessed shall not exceed  $125.

HB 1676.name: HB 1676 Indigenous Peoples Day; renames the special Day of Appreciation for American Indians, etc.

history.text: 12/04/18  House: Prefiled and ordered printed; offered 01/09/19 19100955D
12/04/18  House: Referred to Committee on Rules

HB 1676.committeeText: 12/04/18  House: Referred to Committee on Rules
HB 1676.summary:
Legal holidays; Indigenous Peoples Day.
Renames the special Day of Appreciation for American  Indians living
in the Commonwealth as Indigenous  Peoples Day. Recognition of the
day remains the Wednesday  immediately preceding the fourth Thursday
in November of each year but the bill changes its designation to that
of a legal holiday  in Virginia.

HB 1677.name: HB 1677 Motor vehicles, certain; expands mileage for driving distance for testing, etc.

history.text: 12/04/18  House: Prefiled and ordered printed; offered 01/09/19 19100658D
12/04/18  House: Referred to Committee on Transportation

HB 1677.committeeText: 12/04/18  House: Referred to Committee on Transportation
HB 1677.summary:
Driving distance for testing certain motor vehicles.
 Expands from five miles to 10 miles the distance (i)  from the place
of business that an individual is permitted  to drive a vehicle equipped
with a license plate designed for persons  engaged in the business
of delivering unladen motor vehicles to test the installation, service,
or repair of  equipment on or in such vehicle and (ii) from an auto
auction that a prospective purchaser of a  motor vehicle, trailer,
or semitrailer may operate such vehicle without a  safety inspection
prior to purchase.

HB 1678.name: HB 1678 Golf carts and utility vehicles; adds Town of Dendron to list of towns that may authorize operation.

history.text: 12/04/18  House: Prefiled and ordered printed; offered 01/09/19 19100462D
12/04/18  House: Referred to Committee on Transportation

HB 1678.committeeText: 12/04/18  House: Referred to Committee on Transportation
HB 1678.summary:
Golf carts and utility vehicles; Town of Dendron.
Adds  the Town of Dendron to the list of towns that may authorize
the operation of  golf carts and utility vehicles on designated public
highways despite not having established their own police departments.

HB 1679.name: HB 1679 All-terrain vehicles (ATVs), mopeds, and off-road motorcycles; clarifies taxation on vehicles, etc.

history.text: 12/05/18  House: Prefiled and ordered printed; offered 01/09/19 19100726D
12/05/18  House: Referred to Committee on Finance

HB 1679.committeeText: 12/05/18  House: Referred to Committee on Finance
HB 1679.summary:
Taxation of all-terrain vehicles, mopeds, and
off-road  motorcycles. Clarifies the taxation of  all-terrain
vehicles, mopeds, and off-road motorcycles and provides that  vehicles
that qualify as farm equipment that is  exempt from sales and use
tax shall be exempt from the motor vehicle sales and  use tax. The
bill contains technical amendments.

HB 1680.name: HB 1680 Certificate of public need; changes to Medical Care Facilities Certificate of Public Need Program.

history.text: 12/05/18  House: Prefiled and ordered printed; offered 01/09/19 19100914D
12/05/18  House: Referred to Committee on Health, Welfare and Institutions

HB 1680.committeeText: 12/05/18  House: Referred to Committee on Health, Welfare and Institutions

HB 1681.name: HB 1681 Income tax credits; housing choice vouchers, eligible housing areas.

history.text: 12/05/18  House: Prefiled and ordered printed; offered 01/09/19 19101630D
12/05/18  House: Referred to Committee on Finance

HB 1681.committeeText: 12/05/18  House: Referred to Committee on Finance
HB 1681.summary:
Income tax credits; housing choice vouchers;
eligible  housing areas. Expands the definition of "eligible housing
area"  for purposes of the housing choice voucher tax credit,  to
include census tracts in the Virginia Beach-Norfolk-Newport News Metropolitan
 Statistical Area in which less than 10 percent of  the population
lives below the poverty level. Landlords who rent qualified  housing
units within such areas are eligible for an income tax credit. Current
 law only applies to such areas within the Richmond Metropolitan Statistical
 Area.

HB 1682.name: HB 1682 Insurance networks; dental services.

history.text: 12/06/18  House: Prefiled and ordered printed; offered 01/09/19 19100316D
12/06/18  House: Referred to Committee on Commerce and Labor

HB 1682.committeeText: 12/06/18  House: Referred to Committee on Commerce and Labor
HB 1682.summary:
Insurance networks; dental services. Establishes
limits  on the ability of a health insurer or other person to sell
or otherwise grant  access, as provided in a dentist's or oral surgeon's
provider contract, to a  third-party carrier. Access as provided in
a provider contract refers to the  right to have dental services provided
by the participating provider to the  enrollees of the third-party
carrier in accordance with the terms of a provider  contract. The
measure provides that such access may be granted only if it is expressly
permitted by the provider  contract and notice is given to the affected
participating providers.

HB 1683.name: HB 1683 Electric cooperatives; authorized to increase or decrease its rates without SCC approval, etc.

history.text: 12/06/18  House: Prefiled and ordered printed; offered 01/09/19 19101783D
12/06/18  House: Referred to Committee on Commerce and Labor

HB 1683.committeeText: 12/06/18  House: Referred to Committee on Commerce and Labor
HB 1683.summary:
Electric cooperatives; rates. Authorizes
any electric  cooperative to (i) increase or decrease its rates without
State Corporation  Commission approval for any of its services, rather
than only for distribution  services, at any time if such adjustments
will not effect a cumulative net  increase or decrease in excess of
5 percent in such rates in any three year  period; (ii) if it does
not hold a membership interest in a utility aggregation  cooperative
and the facility that is the subject of the petition is either  owned
by the cooperative or has achieved commercial operation, petition
the  Commission for approval of one or more rate adjustment clauses
for the timely  and current recovery from customers of the costs of
generation facilities,  underground facilities to replace certain
existing overhead distribution  facilities, or certain pumped hydroelectricity
generation and storage  facilities; (iii) adjust the total system
cap for net energy metering,  agricultural net energy metering, and
small agricultural generators to up to  five percent of the cooperative's
highest total coincident system peak within  the past five years;
and (iv) subject to findings that it will not result in  either an
intra-class or inter-class change in cost recovery, adopt any rate,
 rate component, program, tariff, or terms or conditions of service
that the  Commission has previously approved for any other cooperative.

HB 1684.name: HB 1684 Waiver of extradition; a judge is required to revoke bail of any person who waives proceedings, etc.

history.text: 12/06/18  House: Prefiled and ordered printed; offered 01/09/19 19100921D
12/06/18  House: Referred to Committee for Courts of Justice

HB 1684.committeeText: 12/06/18  House: Referred to Committee for Courts of Justice
HB 1684.summary:
Waiver of extradition; bail. Requires a
judge to revoke  the bail of any person who waives extradition proceedings
in writing and remand  such person to custody to await transfer to
the demanding state.

HB 1685.name: HB 1685 Public schools; enrolled students, disorderly conduct.

history.text: 12/06/18  House: Prefiled and ordered printed; offered 01/09/19 19100685D
12/06/18  House: Referred to Committee for Courts of Justice

HB 1685.committeeText: 12/06/18  House: Referred to Committee for Courts of Justice
HB 1685.summary:
Public schools; enrolled students; disorderly
conduct.  Provides that no enrolled public school student who
disrupts the operation of  the school at which he is enrolled or any
activity conducted or sponsored by  the school at which he is enrolled
on school grounds during normal school hours  is guilty of disorderly
conduct.

HB 1686.name: HB 1686 Electric utilities; limitations on fossil fuel facilities.

history.text: 12/06/18  House: Prefiled and ordered printed; offered 01/09/19 19100059D
12/06/18  House: Referred to Committee on Commerce and Labor

HB 1686.committeeText: 12/06/18  House: Referred to Committee on Commerce and Labor
HB 1686.summary:
Electric utilities; limitations on fossil fuel
facilities.  Prohibits the State Corporation Commission (SCC)
from issuing on or after July  1, 2019, a certificate of public convenience
and necessity or granting any other  permit or approval required for
the construction or operation by an electric  utility of a new fossil
fuel facility or for the expansion or continued  operation of an existing
fossil fuel facility before first approving the  construction and
placing in service of renewable energy generation facilities  having
in the aggregate a rated capacity of 5,500 megawatts. The measure
also  prohibits the SCC on or after  July 1, 2019, from authorizing
or permitting an electric utility or re-permitting an existing idle
fossil fuel facility to  increase purchases of electric power under
any agreement with another person,  if the electric power is or will
be generated at a fossil fuel facility, before  first approving the
construction and placing in service of such renewable  energy generation
facilities.

HB 1687.name: HB 1687 Nonpayment of wages; private action.

history.text: 12/07/18  House: Prefiled and ordered printed; offered 01/09/19 19100994D
12/07/18  House: Referred to Committee for Courts of Justice

HB 1687.committeeText: 12/07/18  House: Referred to Committee for Courts of Justice
HB 1687.summary:
Nonpayment of wages; private action. Provides
that an  employee has a private cause of action against an employer
who fails to pay  wages to recover the amount of wages due plus interest
at eight percent  annually from the date the wages were due. If the
court finds that the employer  knowingly failed to pay wages, the
court shall award the employee reasonable  attorney fees and other
costs. If the court finds that the employer's failure  to pay wages
was willful and with intent to defraud the employee, the court  shall
also award the employee three times the amount of wages due.

HB 1688.name: HB 1688 Disorderly conduct; students.

history.text: 12/07/18  House: Prefiled and ordered printed; offered 01/09/19 19100704D
12/07/18  House: Committee    Referral Pending

HB 1688.summary:
Disorderly conduct; students. Provides that
a student  at any elementary or secondary school shall not be  guilty
of disorderly conduct in public places if the  disorderly conduct
occurred on school property or a school bus.

HJ 577.name: HJ 577 United States Constitution; ratifies Equal Rights Amendment.

history.text: 07/20/18  House: Prefiled and ordered printed; offered 01/09/19 19100132D
07/20/18  House: Committee    Referral Pending

HJ 577.summary:
Constitution of the United States;  Equal Rights
Amendment. Ratifies the Equal Rights Amendment to the  Constitution
of the United States that was proposed  by Congress in 1972. The joint
resolution advocates  the position that the 1972 Equal Rights Amendment
remains viable and may be  ratified notwithstanding the expiration
of the 10-year ratification period set  out in the resolving clause,
as amended, in the proposal adopted by Congress.

HJ 578.name: HJ 578 Constitutional amendment; right to vote (first reference).

history.text: 07/23/18  House: Prefiled and ordered printed; offered 01/09/19 19100131D
07/23/18  House: Committee    Referral Pending

HJ 578.summary:
Constitutional amendment (first resolution);
right to vote.  Provides that there is a right to vote and that
no law shall be enacted or  enforced that burdens or denies any voter
of his right to vote. The amendment also  requires the Commonwealth
and its political subdivisions to provide all  resources necessary
to assist qualified voters in the exercise of their right  to vote.
